result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen W. Motley

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:09 AM Defendant Allen W. Motley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert N Forseth appeared by video for Allen W. Motley.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Cases 20CF176, 2022CF000040, 2022CF000069, 2022CF000070, 2022CF000076, 2022CF000136, and 2022CF000256.
Court questions the parties.
Atty Forseth informs the court that there is one issue of where the sentence will be served.
Court  states it does not have any ability to determine if the defendant will be serving in prison or in jail as that is determined by the Dept. of Corrections.
ADA Dodge informs the court that the offer is the same and now the defendant doesn't want to agree.
These cases were scheduled for trial and were removed for this plea & sentencing date today.
Atty Forseth and the defendant are sent to a break out room - Judge will break for 5 mins.
10:33 AM Court back in session.  Parties inform the court they need to schedule a trial for 20CF176.
Calendar call scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Appearances: State of WI appears by ADA Jedidiah Dodge; Defendant appears from Waupaca County Jail with Atty Robert Forseth; All appearances via Marathon County Zoom. 
Date and time set for a motion hearing.
VRCW.

COURT notes cases are set for a speedy trial, and nothing has been filed as far a (MIL) Motion in Limine and (JI) Jury Instructions.
COURT questions which case is going to trial.
ADA Dodge makes statement re: 22CF256, also filed motion to join cases.
COURT notes there was a speedy demand recently filed in 22CF76.
ADA Dodge indicates Defendant is being held on the cash bond in 22CF256.
Parties in agreement that 22CF256 will be the case that goes to trial next week, satisfying the time limits.
Atty Forseth has no objections to the MIL filed, but objects to the joinder of the cases.
COURT has reviewed State's Motion to Join cases.
ADA Dodge recites basis for motion.
COURT addresses parties.
Atty Forseth states objections to motion, his client only wishes to proceed in 22CF256.
COURT addresses parties re: joining cases and trial being held in 1 day.
ADA Dodge indicates if joinder is not granted, he is requesting an Other Acts hearing.
COURT addresses parties.
COURT denies motion to join cases, reiterates 22CF256 will be tried separately from the rest of the cases, and notes Other Acts will need to be addressed.
Re: Other Acts:
Parties stipulate that COURT can decide that prior to trial, another hearing is not necessary. 
COURT addresses parties re: Sullivan test.
COURT requests parties to respond to Other Acts in writing, and hearing will be held prior to trial.
COURT addresses MIL;
#4 will be addressed morning of JT.
No objections. 
COURT grants MIL.
COURT instructs parties re: final offer.
Atty Forseth in agreement with JI and does not plan on filing anymore.

DATES to remain.

Adjourned: 	9:28 a.m.

11:13 AM Defendant Allen W. Motley appeared by video, in custody from Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney (Atty) Robert N Forseth appeared by video for Allen W. Motley.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases 20CF176, 22CF40, 22CF69, 22CF70, 22CF76, 22CF136, and 22CF256.
Atty Forseth requests one bond cover all cases or reduction of bond in 22CF256.
ADA Dodge objections are heard and requests the bond modification motion be denied.
BY THE COURT:  Motion to modify bond is denied.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Modify Bond filed by Atty Robert N Forseth (sent to Judge Moran on 09/01/22 sp)
filed by Atty Robert N Forseth
Calendar call on September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Atty Robert Forseth appointed
Notice of Motion and Motion for Discovery and Inspection filed by the Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Motion for a Speedy Trial filed by the Defendant
sent to Judge Moran on 07/15/22 sp
Calendar call on July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:05 AM Defendant Allen W. Motley appeared by video.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner appeared by video for Allen W. Motley.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
All files heard: 20CF176, 22CF40, 22CF69, 22CF70, 22CF76, 22CF136, 22CF256

Parties state their appearances. 
Court questions if there are victims present. 
Atty Dodge indicates there is not. 

Court questions the status of the cases.  
Atty Dodge responds.  20CF176 is set for a status conference and all other files set for arraignment. 
Defendant received copy of the informations in each of these files.  
Atty Gardner notes he has not made an appearance yet on 22CF256 enters an appearance on this matter as well today. 
Atty Gardner waives reading of the informations.  Understands the information in 22CF256 mirrors the complaint. 

Atty Gardner stands mute.
Court enters NOT GUILTY plea(s) to all the counts in each of the informations that have been filed.

Defendant makes statements to the court. 
Court addresses the defendant and asks that he allow the court to run this hearing. 

Court questions if a speedy trial is being requested. 
Atty Gardner makes statements.  He just got on board for 22CF256.  Sees that the defendant filed a pro se motion to modify the bail in that matter.  Asks to set that pro se motion as soon as possible.  He will meet with his client at the Waupaca County jail as soon as possible.  
Defendant again interrupts the court and states he wants a speedy trial. 

Court will set the matter for a bond motion with the judicial assistant.   
Court informs the defendant he will be muting him if he does not stop interrupting the court. 
Court informs the defendant to speak with his attorney.  A bond hearing will be set as soon as possible and the defendant can discuss the speedy trial demand with his attorney. 

Calendar call set for next Thursday 7/21/2022 at 1:00 p.m.  Parties are to call in to set the bond modification hearing. 
Defendant again states he wants a speedy trial. 
Atty Gardner states he will be speaking with the defendant tomorrow. 
Defendant asks to speak to the court. 
Court will allow him to do that if his attorney allows him to. 
Atty Gardner informs the defendant not to speak. 
Defendant continues to make statements. 
Court  is adjourned.
Calendar call scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report. Filed by Atty Drury. - 125 contacts made, SPD has not secured representation.
Arraignment on July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on July 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on July 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm. - NOT MAILED
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to sender Vacant
Judge Michael Moran assigned
/s/ 6/22/2022 LJM - Approved.
records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Robert Gardner
Pre-trial conference on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:12 PM Defendant Allen W. Motley in court.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF40, 22CF69, 22CF70, 22CF76 and 22CF136.

Defendant states that his Attorney is Robert Gardner.
Defendant states that he is here in the courthouse today.
Court will recall this case.

3:34 p.m.  ADA Dodge recalls the cases.
Defendant now appears with his Attorney Robert Gardner.
All cases will be waivers.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

Atty Gardner would ask that the arraignment can be held at a later date as he would like to speak with his client before 
entering any pleas.
Court informs Atty Gardner that he needs to file a retainer of each of these cases.

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:33 PM Defendant Allen W. Motley in court.   Atty Robert Gardner appeared in person on behalf of the defendant. ADA Kelly Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin in court. 
Cases heard today are 22CF40, 22CF69, 22CF70, 22CF76 and 22CF136.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held for all felony cases.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued on all cases.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter to the defendant in re:  Court requesting denial letter from the Public Defender's Office

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Allen W. Motley in court. 
All files heard: 22CF40, 22CF69, 22CF70, 22CF76, 22CF136

Defendant states he spoke with his attorney, Robert Gardner, who he thought would be here today. 
Court questions the defendant regarding other files
Atty Mutchler has no received notices of retainer in any of the files. 
Court informs the defendant that we are not proceeding because those have not been filed.  Notes the defendant was denied by the public defender. 
Defendant states he doesn't know why he's not here today.  

BY THE COURT: 
Court will not adjourn these cases out again and gives the defendant two options: 
1 - Hire Atty Gardner and have him file a notice of retainer. 
2 - Apply for appointment thru the court by filing a petition for indigency if he thinks he might be eligible. 

Defendant states he is aware of his bonds and conditions. 
Court informs the defendant to go to the Branch 2 office to obtain an indigency petition.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on March 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

01:43 PM Defendant Allen W. Motley in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 22CF40, 22CF69, 22CF70, 22CF76

Court questions the defendant regarding counsel. 
Defendant indicates he has been trying to get in touch with his attorney that he has on previously charges. Hes called and left voicemails. 
Court reviews the previous minutes and questions the defendant further. 
Defendant states he does not qualify for a public defender.  

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation and court appointed counsel. 
Defendant would like to complete the paperwork to have a court appointed attorney. 

Court adjourns. 

BY THE COURT:  Bonds are continued.

22CF70 bond has not been set. 
State requests a $500 signature bondin 22CF70. 
Follow all other open bonds.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial Appearance set for February 28, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid a prescription and only as prescribed.
Do not associate with others who consume controlled substances illegally.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Mutchler appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Soule appears in court for defendant by phone.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Drug Paraphernalia and Bail Jumping (Felony). 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
Court informs the defendant of his rights to an attorney and of his upcoming hearing.

State requests a $2000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty  does not have any objections as to bond. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for: 02-28-2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Branch 1.
